div.p: All of these RESTful exchange mechanisms follow the same basic pattern - a resource of some type is transmitted from Data Source to Data Consumer using a simple REST command and the appropriate endpoint. The Data Consumer either stores the data as requested (and acknowledges that success with an appropriate HTTP code) or it rejects it. If accepted, a new 'version' of the resource is persisted at the specified endpoint and can potentially be referenced by other resources or subsequently queried or further manipulated.
